name: equinix-metal
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing equinix-metal cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`metal` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/equinix/terraform-provider-metal).

authToken.description: The API auth key for API operations.

cidr.description: CIDR suffix for IP address block to be assigned, i.e. amount of addresses.

reservationIds.description: String of UUID of IP block reservations from which the public IPv4 address should be taken.

cidr.description: CIDR suffix for IP address block to be assigned, i.e. amount of addresses.

family.description:
IP version - "4" or "6"
* `network_type` Network type of a device, used in [Layer 2 networking](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/networking/layer2/). Will be one of `layer3`, `hybrid`, `layer2-individual` and `layer2-bonded`.

public.description: whether the address is routable from the Internet

bonded.description:
Whether this port is part of a bond in bonded network setup
* `project_id`- The ID of the project the device belongs to

mac.description: MAC address assigned to the port

asn.description: Autonomous System Number for local BGP deployment

deploymentType.description: `private` or `public`, the `private` is likely to be usable immediately, the `public` will need to be review by Equinix Metal engineers

maxPrefix.description: The maximum number of route filters allowed per server

md5.description: Password for BGP session in plaintext (not a checksum)

status.description: status of BGP configuration in the project

md5Enabled.description: Whether BGP session is password enabled

md5Password.description: BGP session password in plaintext (not a checksum)

multihop.description: Whether the neighbor is in EBGP multihop session

peerAs.description: Peer AS number (different than customer_as for EBGP)

peerIps.description: Array of IP addresses of this neighbor's peers

routesIns.description: Array of incoming routes. Each route has attributes:

routesOuts.description: Array of outgoing routes in the same format

cidr.description: Bit length of the network mask of the address

public.description: Whether the address is routable from the Internet

bonded.description: Whether this port is part of a bond in bonded network setup

mac.description: MAC address assigned to the port

asn.description: Autonomous System Number for local BGP deployment

deploymentType.description: `private` or `public`, the `private` is likely to be usable immediately, the `public` will need to be review by Equinix Metal engineers

maxPrefix.description: The maximum number of route filters allowed per server

md5.description: Password for BGP session in plaintext (not a checksum)

status.description: status of BGP configuration in the project

provider.description:
The provider type for the metal package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

authToken.description: The API auth key for API operations.

equinix-metal:index/bgpSession:BgpSessio.description:
Provides a resource to manage BGP sessions in Equinix Metal Host. Refer to [Equinix Metal BGP documentation](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/networking/local-global-bgp/) for more details.

You need to have BGP config enabled in your project.

BGP session must be linked to a device running [BIRD](https://bird.network.cz) or other BGP routing daemon which will control route advertisements via the session to Equinix Metal's upstream routers.

defaultRoute.description: Boolean flag to set the default route policy. False by default.
Boolean flag to set the default route policy. False by default.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering BgpSession resources.

defaultRoute.description: Boolean flag to set the default route policy. False by default.

accessPrivateIpv4.description: The ipv4 private IP assigned to the device

accessPublicIpv4.description: The ipv4 maintenance IP assigned to the device

accessPublicIpv6.description: The ipv6 maintenance IP assigned to the device

alwaysPxe.description:
If true, a device with OS `custom_ipxe` will
continue to boot via iPXE on reboots.

created.description: The timestamp for when the device was created

customData.description: A string of the desired Custom Data for the device.

deployedFacility.description: The facility where the device is deployed.

deployedHardwareReservationId.description: ID of hardware reservation where this device was deployed. It is useful when using the `next-available` hardware reservation.

facilities.description: List of facility codes with deployment preferences. Equinix Metal API will go through the list and will deploy your device to first facility with free capacity. List items must be facility codes or `any` (a wildcard). To find the facility code, visit [Facilities API docs](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/api/facilities/), set your API auth token in the top of the page and see JSON from the API response.

forceDetachVolumes.description: Delete device even if it has volumes attached. Only applies for destroy action.

ipAddresses.description: A list of IP address types for the device (structure is documented below).

ipxeScriptUrl.description:
URL pointing to a hosted iPXE script. More
information is in the
[Custom iPXE](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/servers/custom-ipxe/)
doc.

networkType.deprecationMessage: You should handle Network Type with the new metal_device_network_type resource.

networks.description:
The device's private and public IP (v4 and v6) network details. When a device is run without any special network configuration, it will have 3 networks:
* Public IPv4 at `metal_device.name.network.0`
* IPv6 at `metal_device.name.network.1`
* Private IPv4 at `metal_device.name.network.2`
Elastic addresses then stack by type - an assigned public IPv4 will go after the management public IPv4 (to index 1), and will then shift the indices of the IPv6 and private IPv4. Assigned private IPv4 will go after the management private IPv4 (to the end of the network list).
The fields of the network attributes are:

operatingSystem.description: The operating system slug. To find the slug, or visit [Operating Systems API docs](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/api/operatingsystems), set your API auth token in the top of the page and see JSON from the API response.

plan.description: The device plan slug. To find the plan slug, visit [Device plans API docs](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/api/plans), set your auth token in the top of the page and see JSON from the API response.

projectId.description: The ID of the project in which to create the device

projectSshKeyIds.description: Array of IDs of the project SSH keys which should be added to the device. If you omit this, SSH keys of all the members of the parent project will be added to the device. If you specify this array, only the listed project SSH keys will be added. Project SSH keys can be created with the equinix-metal.ProjectSshKey resource.

rootPassword.description: Root password to the server (disabled after 24 hours)

sshKeyIds.description: List of IDs of SSH keys deployed in the device, can be both user and project SSH keys

storage.description:
JSON for custom partitioning. Only usable on reserved hardware. More information in in the [Custom Partitioning and RAID](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/servers/custom-partitioning-raid/) doc.
* Please note that the disks.partitions.size attribute must be a string, not an integer. It can be a number string, or size notation string, e.g. "4G" or "8M" (for gigabytes and megabytes).

updated.description: The timestamp for the last time the device was updated

userData.description: A string of the desired User Data for the device.

waitForReservationDeprovision.description: Only used for devices in reserved hardware. If set, the deletion of this device will block until the hardware reservation is marked provisionable (about 4 minutes in August 2019).

alwaysPxe.description:
If true, a device with OS `custom_ipxe` will
continue to boot via iPXE on reboots.

customData.description: A string of the desired Custom Data for the device.

facilities.description: List of facility codes with deployment preferences. Equinix Metal API will go through the list and will deploy your device to first facility with free capacity. List items must be facility codes or `any` (a wildcard). To find the facility code, visit [Facilities API docs](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/api/facilities/), set your API auth token in the top of the page and see JSON from the API response.

ipAddresses.description: A list of IP address types for the device (structure is documented below).

URL pointing to a hosted iPXE script. More

[Custom iPXE](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/servers/custom-ipxe/)
doc.

Project SSH keys can be created with the equinix-metal.ProjectSshKey resource.

JSON for custom partitioning. Only usable on reserved hardware. More information in in the [Custom Partitioning and RAID](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/servers/custom-partitioning-raid/) doc.
* Please note that the disks.partitions.size attribute must be a string, not an integer. It can be a number string, or size notation string, e.g. "4G" or "8M" (for gigabytes and megabytes).

equinix-metal:index/deviceNetworkType:De.description:
## Import

This resource can also be imported using existing device ID

```sh
 $ pulumi import equinix-metal:index/deviceNetworkType:DeviceNetworkType metal_device_network_type {existing device_id}
```

deviceId.description: The ID of the device on which the network type should be set.

type.description: Network type to set. Must be one of `layer3`, `hybrid`, `layer2-individual` and `layer2-bonded`.

deviceId.description: The ID of the device on which the network type should be set.

type.description: Network type to set. Must be one of `layer3`, `hybrid`, `layer2-individual` and `layer2-bonded`.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering DeviceNetworkType resources.

deviceId.description: The ID of the device on which the network type should be set.

type.description: Network type to set. Must be one of `layer3`, `hybrid`, `layer2-individual` and `layer2-bonded`.

equinix-metal:index/ipAttachment:IpAttac.description:
Provides a resource to attach elastic IP subnets to devices.

To attach an IP subnet from a reserved block to a provisioned device, you must derive a subnet CIDR belonging to
one of your reserved blocks in the same project and facility as the target device.

For example, you have reserved IPv4 address block 147.229.10.152/30, you can choose to assign either the whole
block as one subnet to a device; or 2 subnets with CIDRs 147.229.10.152/31' and 147.229.10.154/31; or 4 subnets
with mask prefix length 32. More about the elastic IP subnets is [here](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/networking/elastic-ips/).

Device and reserved block must be in the same facility.

cidr.description: length of CIDR prefix of the subnet as integer

cidrNotation.description:
CIDR notation of subnet from block reserved in the same
project and facility as the device

deviceId.description: ID of device to which to assign the subnet

gateway.description: IP address of gateway for the subnet

netmask.description: Subnet mask in decimal notation, e.g. "255.255.255.0"

public.description: boolean flag whether subnet is reachable from the Internet

cidrNotation.description:
CIDR notation of subnet from block reserved in the same
project and facility as the device

deviceId.description: ID of device to which to assign the subnet

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering IpAttachment resources.

cidr.description: length of CIDR prefix of the subnet as integer

CIDR notation of subnet from block reserved in the same
project and facility as the device

deviceId.description: ID of device to which to assign the subnet

gateway.description: IP address of gateway for the subnet

netmask.description: Subnet mask in decimal notation, e.g. "255.255.255.0"

public.description: boolean flag whether subnet is reachable from the Internet

deviceId.description: ID of device to be assigned to the VLAN

forceBond.description: Add port back to the bond when this resource is removed. Default is false.

native.description: Mark this VLAN a native VLAN on the port. This can be used only if this assignment assigns second or further VLAN to the port. To ensure that this attachment is not first on a port, you can use `depends_on` pointing to another metal_port_vlan_attachment, just like in the layer2-individual example above.

portName.description: Name of network port to be assigned to the VLAN

deviceId.description: ID of device to be assigned to the VLAN

forceBond.description: Add port back to the bond when this resource is removed. Default is false.

To ensure that this attachment is not first on a port, you can use `depends_on` pointing to another metal_port_vlan_attachment, just like in the layer2-individual example above.

networkType.description: L2 network type of the device, one of "layer3", "layer2-bonded", "layer2-individual", "hybrid"

networks.description:
The device's private and public IP (v4 and v6) network details. When a device is run without any special network configuration, it will have 3 networks:
* Public IPv4 at `metal_device.name.network.0`
* IPv6 at `metal_device.name.network.1`
* Private IPv4 at `metal_device.name.network.2`
Elastic addresses then stack by type - an assigned public IPv4 will go after the management public IPv4 (to index 1), and will then shift the indices of the IPv6 and private IPv4. Assigned private IPv4 will go after the management private IPv4 (to the end of the network list).
The fields of the network attributes are:

operatingSystem.description: The operating system running on the device

plan.description: The hardware config of the device

rootPassword.description: Root password to the server (if still available)

sshKeyIds.description: List of IDs of SSH keys deployed in the device, can be both user or project SSH keys

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getDeviceBgpNeighbors.

deviceId.description: UUID of BGP-enabled device whose neighbors to list

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getDeviceBgpNeighbors.

bgpNeighbors.description: array of BGP neighbor records with attributes:

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getIpBlockRanges.

facility.description: Facility code filtering the IP blocks. Global IPv4 blcoks will be listed anyway. If you omit this, all the block from the project will be listed.

projectId.description: ID of the project from which to list the blocks.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getIpBlockRanges.

globalIpv4s.description: list of CIDR expressions for Global IPv4 blocks in the project

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

ipv6s.description: list of CIDR expressions for IPv6 blocks in the project

privateIpv4s.description: list of CIDR expressions for Private IPv4 blocks in the project

publicIpv4s.description: list of CIDR expressions for Public IPv4 blocks in the project

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getOperatingSystem.

name.description: Name or part of the name of the distribution. Case insensitive.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getOperatingSystem.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getOrganization.

organizationId.description: The UUID of the organization resource

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getOrganization.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

projectIds.description: UUIDs of project resources which belong to this organization

equinix-metal:index/getPrecreatedIpBlock.description:
Use this data source to get CIDR expression for precreated IPv6 and IPv4 blocks in Equinix Metal.
You can then use the cidrsubnet TF builtin function to derive subnets.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getPrecreatedIpBlock.

addressFamily.description: 4 or 6, depending on which block you are looking for.

facility.description: Facility of the searched block. (Optional) Only allowed for non-global blocks.

global.description: Whether to look for global block. Default is false for backward compatibility.

projectId.description: ID of the project where the searched block should be.

public.description: Whether to look for public or private block.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getPrecreatedIpBlock.

cidrNotation.description: CIDR notation of the looked up block.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getProject.

name.description: The name which is used to look up the project

projectId.description: The UUID by which to look up the project

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getProject.

backendTransfer.description: Whether Backend Transfer is enabled for this project

bgpConfig.description: Optional BGP settings. Refer to [Equinix Metal guide for BGP](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/networking/local-global-bgp/).

created.description: The timestamp for when the project was created

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

organizationId.description: The UUID of this project's parent organization

paymentMethodId.description: The UUID of payment method for this project

updated.description: The timestamp for the last time the project was updated

userIds.description: List of UUIDs of user accounts which belong to this project

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getProjectSshKey.

id.description: The id of the SSH Key to search for in the Equinix Metal project

projectId.description: The Equinix Metal project id of the Equinix Metal SSH Key

search.description:
The name, fingerprint, or public_key of the SSH Key to search for
in the Equinix Metal project

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getProjectSshKey.

created.description: The timestamp for when the SSH key was created

fingerprint.description: The fingerprint of the SSH key

id.description: The unique ID of the key

name.description: The name of the SSH key

ownerId.description: The ID of parent project (same as project_id)

projectId.description: The ID of parent project

publicKey.description: The text of the public key

updated.description: The timestamp for the last time the SSH key was updated

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getSpotMarketPrice.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getSpotMarketPrice.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

price.description: Current spot market price for given plan in given facility.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getSpotMarketRequest.

requestId.description: The id of the Spot Market Request

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getSpotMarketRequest.

deviceIds.description: List of IDs of devices spawned by the referenced Spot Market Request

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getVolume.

projectId.description: The ID the parent Equinix Metal project (for lookup by name)

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getVolume.

billingCycle.description: The billing cycle, defaults to hourly

deviceIds.description: UUIDs of devices to which this volume is attached

facility.description: The facility slug the volume resides in

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

locked.description: Whether the volume is locked or not

plan.description: Performance plan the volume is on

projectId.description: The project id the volume is in

size.description: The size in GB of the volume
